remarks: Two ways to say that a function in maps-to notation is single-rooted. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 1-Mar-2017.)
statement:
funcnvmpt.0 $e |- F/ x ph $.
funcnvmpt.1 $e |- F/_ x A $.
funcnvmpt.2 $e |- F/_ x F $.
funcnvmpt.3 $e |- F = ( x e. A |-> B ) $.
funcnvmpt.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. A ) -> B e. V ) $.
funcnv5mpt.1 $e |- ( x = z -> B = C ) $.
funcnv5mpt $p |- ( ph -> ( Fun `' F <-> A. x e. A A. z e. A ( x = z \/ B =/= C ) ) ) $.
$d A z $.
$d B z $.
$d C x $.
$d ph z $.
$d x z $.
